metadata.title: CVE-2021-24116 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description: In wolfSSL through 4.6.0, a side-channel vulnerability in base64 PEM filedecoding allows system-level (administrator) attackers to obtaininformation about secret RSA keys via a controlled-channel and side-channelattack on software running in isolated environments that can be singlestepped, especially Intel SGX.

criterions.comment: wolfssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
